content.data: Return -  Leaves the Part Editor and Returns to the Parts List View.
There is one option in the sidebar:

The Edgeband 
 Editor allows you to assign Edgebanding to your Parts. You must have Edgeband 
 Materials and have setup  Edgeband 
 Indicators  in the  Material 
 Catalog  in order to fully utilize this facility.

The Edge 
 Banding option allows you define which edge of a Part gets edge banded 
 with which  edgeband 
 indicator . Once the Edge Band option is active you will be placed 
 in Edge Band mode with the following 4 options in the ribbonbar.

Select -  When entering Edgeband mode this tool is selected 
	 by default. Simply click on the edge you would like to apply the Edgeband 
	 to and then select its type in the sidebar.

Select -  When entering Edgeband mode this tool is selected 
	 by default. Simply click on the edge you would like to apply the Edgeband 
	 to and then select its type in the sidebar.

Select -  When entering Edgeband mode this tool is selected 
	 by default. Simply click on the edge you would like to apply the Edgeband 
	 to and then select its type in the sidebar.

You can use Windows  
 + Click  to select multiple edges.

Select All -  
	 To quickly change all Edges to a specific Edgeband select this option 
	 then select their type in the sidebar. 
 
 Remove Banding -  
	 Will remove Edgebanding from the selected edge(s). 
 
 Set Banding -  
	 Will expose the Edgeband type selector in the sidebar without having 
	 to select an edge first.

Select All -  
	 To quickly change all Edges to a specific Edgeband select this option 
	 then select their type in the sidebar.

Select All -  
	 To quickly change all Edges to a specific Edgeband select this option 
	 then select their type in the sidebar.

Remove Banding -  
	 Will remove Edgebanding from the selected edge(s).

Remove Banding -  
	 Will remove Edgebanding from the selected edge(s).

Set Banding -  
	 Will expose the Edgeband type selector in the sidebar without having 
	 to select an edge first.

Set Banding -  
	 Will expose the Edgeband type selector in the sidebar without having 
	 to select an edge first.

It is important to note that the default values in the sidebar options 
 are NOT representative of the current Edge Banding on the selected Part. 
 To use this function simply select which Edgebanding type you would like.

Once the Banding options are chosen simply select any of the Part Edges 
 you would like these Edgeband properties assigned to. In the image below 
 the Front Edge of the End has been selected.

Note that the front edge is now red which indicates an Edgeband has 
 been applied. Once you are through defining the Edges simply click the 
 Return   option 
 to save the new Edge Properties.
